examples: What are we having for afters, Mum? I really want ice cream.

entries.meaning: (informal) The festivities held after a wedding meal.
examples: To keep costs down at our wedding, we only had family at the banquet, but invited all our friends to the afters.

entries.meaning: (Britain, Ireland, informal, sports) Fighting or arguing off the ball or when play has stopped.
examples: 42-2: From the other end Strauss has a bit of afters with Morne Morkel after yet another bouncer raps him on the gloves.

entries.meaning: (UK) An After-hours drinking session in a public house.
examples: The lights flashed when the landlord shouted, “Last round of drinks before bar closes. Here[sic] me folks, no 'Afters' tonight mates!”
